item.title: General Architechture of Machine Learning
item.description: Business Understanding: Understand the give use case and also it’s good to know more about the domain for which the use cases are built.

item.title: Tags System
item.description: PARA Methods P.A.R.A. stands for Projects — Areas — Resources — Archives, the four top-level categories that encompass every type of information you might encounter in your work and life.

item.title: What is linear regression?
item.description: Linear Regressions Linear regressions tends to establish a relationship between a dependent variable Y and one or more independent variable X by finding the best fit of the straight line.

item.title: What is machine learning?
item.description: Machine learning is the scientific study of algorithms and statistical models that computer systems use to affectively perform a specific task without using explicit instruction, relyring on patterns and inference instead.

item.title: What is ordinary least square model?
item.description: OLS (Ordinary Least Square) is a stats model, which will help us in identifying the more significant features that can has an influence on the output.

item.title: What is the difference between AI, DS, ML and DL?
item.description: Artificial Intelligence AI is purely math and scientifc exercise, but when it became computational, it started to solve human problems formalized into [[a subset of computer science]].

item.title: What is the difference between supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning?
item.description: Supervised Learning In a supervised learning model, the algorithm learns on a labeled dataset, to generate reasonable predictions for the response to new data.
